definition: to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas

sentences.english: To learn from foreign countries is entirely different from worshipping everything foreign.
sentences.chinese: 学习外国与崇洋媚外完全是两回事。

definition: to fawn on foreigners/to pander to foreign powers
to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas
to recount history but omit one's ancestors (idiom); to forget one's roots
(derog.) wannabe foreigner, a Chinese person who apes the ways of foreigners
lit. Yelang thinks highly of itself (idiom)/fig. foolish conceit
angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
shit youth/used satirically against 憤青|愤青 which shares the same sound/see also 憤青|愤青[fen4 qing1]
to revere the past and neglect the present (idiom)
Japanophile (refers to teenage craze for everything Japanese, originally mainly in Taiwan)
